about_the_game:
YUMEGIDO is an exploratory Newton-Noir game in which players find themselves in a room with a shattered glass window. As players progress through the game, YUMEGIDO interacts with their cognitive space, guiding them toward the termination of the YUMEGIDO program.

Overview of YUMEGIDO

Players are allotted a room. In the majority of cases, the room permits movement in four directions: east, west, south, and north. Players have the ability to move in any direction based on their choices. However, if the chosen direction is not one that is deemed correct by YUMEGIDO, players may, at times, find themselves returned to the starting point.

Features of YUMEGIDO

YUMEGIDO engages with the player's Newtonian inductive reasoning through the placement of objects in the room. To reach the Newton-Noir conclusion proposed by YUMEGIDO, players must employ their reasoning abilities to ascertain the correct direction to move. Through this curriculum, YUMEGIDO players inherently assimilate a Newton-Noir cognitive framework and evolve to a state that transcends the conventional player.

Distinctive Content and Systems

YUMEGIDO possesses distinctive content and systems. These include charming apples, fragile sunlight, suspicious delivery personnel, and love and its applications. YUMEGIDO ensures that these elements serve as both content and systems simultaneously.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows8/10/11
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 M380
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD 4000
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 1200 MB available space

publishers: トロヤマイバッテリーズフライド
short_description: YUMEGIDO urges the termination of YUMEGIDO.
